Here are some recommendations based on the user's preferences:

- The Nightingale (2015)): This movie stars Lily James as a young woman who falls in love with a nobleman during World War II. The film explores themes of loyalty, sacrifice, and ultimately love conquering all.

- Ella Enchanted (2004)): This movie stars Anne Hathaway as Ella Greenhand, the daughter of an impoverished farmer. The film follows Ella's journey from a simple farm girl to a powerful fairy queen, and through her adventures she learns about friendship, loyalty, and ultimately love conquering all.

- White Night (2007)): This movie stars Richard Gere as Harry Thorne, an old-time New York detective who has been retired for 30 years. The film follows Harry's journey from a retirement living in his old New York apartment to a redemption journey of self-discovery and ultimately love conquering all.

- The Time Machine (1895)): This movie stars George Pickard as the Time Traveler, a man who has invented a time machine that allows him to travel through time. The film follows the Time Traveler's journey from a life of invention living in a Victorian mansion in London England to a journey through time to witness events that took place during his own lifetime.

- Title: Mama (2013) | Plot: Ever since surviving a domestic violence attack, Kim Addison has found the courage to take matters into her own hands. After learning MMA training in order to learn self- defense, Kim found the confidence to become a trainer herself. She has since set out to help others who have been victims of bullying and abuse just like her. Kim' s personal mission is to empower, inspire and train women and children so they too can stand up for themselves against bullying. Among her students is 13- year- old Logan Chauvin. Logan was terrorized daily in school by callous bullies. He has been training vigorously with Kim to overcome his experience and is now getting ready for his first real MMA fight. Although Kim has done everything in her power to train Logan to stand up to bullies at school, there is very little she can do to protect him from his first real MMA opponent.

Based on your preferences and the information provided, here are some movie recommendations:
- "The Odyssey" (2008): This epic film tells the story of Odysseus, a Greek hero who embarks on a long and dangerous journey home after ten years of war. Along the way, he faces numerous challenges, including storms, pirates, and even supernatural entities. Despite these obstacles, Odysseus perseveres and eventually reaches Ithaka, his final destination. This epic film is an excellent choice for anyone who enjoys epic adventures or classic Greek mythology.
- "Holes" (106): This coming-of-age film tells the story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who grows up in a middle-class suburb of New York City. Despite growing up in a seemingly perfect environment, Holden Caulfield struggles to find his place in the world and often becomes disillusioned with the conventions and expectations of society. In an attempt to find meaning and purpose in life, Holden Caulfield embarks on a journey through the streets of New York City, accompanied by his loyal dog, Whiffle. As Holden Caulfield navigates through the diverse and chaotic streets of New York City, he encounters numerous challenges, including confrontations with authority figures, encounters with individuals who challenge his beliefs and values, and even encounters with supernatural entities or beings from alternative dimensions or parallel universes. Despite encountering these numerous challenges, Holden Caulfield perseveres and ultimately manages to overcome all of these numerous challenges and obstacles that he encountered along the way as he navigated through the streets of New York City. Ultimately, this coming-of-age film serves as an excellent reminder to individuals who are growing up in today's world that even though the conventions and expectations of society may seem like they are perfect and never-changing, in reality, those conventions and expectations of society are actually constantly changing and evolving as new ideas, perspectives, and values are developed and introduced into society. In other words, the conventions and expectations of society are not constant and unchanging as individuals who are growing up in today's world may initially think that they are. Instead, the conventions and expectations of society are actually constantly changing and evolving as new ideas, perspectives, and values are developed and introduced into society.

Based on the user's preference cues and the movies they listed, I would recommend X- Men: First Class.

This movie follows two superpowered humans, Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr, who work together in the 1960s to find others like them.

However, Erik' s vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

Despite these conflicts, both Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr continue to work together throughout the movie to help bring about peace between themselves and the otherworldly beings they encounter.

Overall, X- Men: First Class is a highly entertaining and engaging superhero movie that will entertain audiences of all ages.

conversation.text: Based on your preference cues, I would recommend Aladdin (1992)) as a potential recommendation for The Expendables 2 (2012)). It is a classic animated film that tells the story of Aladdin who discovers he has been granted his greatest wish by a genie. This gift allows him to live on the streets and find ways to survive each day. Even with the cards stacked against him, he stays true to the Christian values instilled by his loving mother. Little did he know how a random act of kindness would change the course of his life forever. In one unexpected moment, Aladdin finds himself face to face with the woman of his dreams. Too bad she was completely out of his league. Comedy and musical numbers ensue as their paths continue to cross.
